instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> once had a short on <TRANSISTOR>Q8961</TRANSISTOR>. After replacing it it worked fine. But just for a while.
<TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> now has a short and it does not turn on. After replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> at the same time it had fans-in again.
but no image :(. Did I fry the GPU? measuring it showed me that atleast it has no short on it. Tho it doesn't get warm and I have a Voltage reading neither on L8960 nor on L8930.
What do you guys think could cause this issue. Should I measure if the traces are good ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message:
Very likely dead GPU.
You can convert it to UMA only...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message: What do you mean with UMA ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message: Disabling GPU, using only Intel Graphics (Unified Memory Architecture).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message: It is already posted on the forum, not to much time ago...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message: Okay, so I have done the GPU bypass / Disable. It seems to work now from internal graphics. Tho i still have a problem with the bypass. If i close the lid it goes into hibrenation. display turns off and so does backlight. If i open it up again. it shows me an image but no backlight. I have tried to attach <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> but that didnt do that much. still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message: You probably have to force PWM to 3V...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> Mosfet replacement
threads.message: that did work just fine. thank you alot
